page.title: 07Kinmount House-2
page.content:
At the bottom end of one of the lakes is a monument to a member of the Queensberry family.This monument stands in the middle of the family burial ground on Gooley Hill.
The monument is said to commemorate one of the family who died in sucpicious circumstances in one of the lakes.Also in this area of the grounds is a quaint little{summer house}which in the hey-day of Kinmount circa 1900 was used for all night parties or for drinking tea in the long summer days. There is also on the lake,the remains of a {boat house}used to store the gondalas of the early 20th century.
As you walk up to the house along the long winding drive you see what you think is a well preserved relic of Scotlands ducal past.
